results.title: May fools = Milou en mai = Milou in May
results.creator_credit: Nouvelles Éditions de Films, TF1 Films productions, Ellepi Films and Louis Malle
results.brief_description: It is May 1968 and the student revolt in Paris is beginning to spread throughout France, but in a large villa in the south-west of France where a family has gathered for the funeral of the grandmother, the division of the estate and a generation of new romances appear to be more important considerations. This delightful comedy was nominated for four Cesar awards and stars Michel Piccoli as the disorganised Milou and Miou Miou as his efficient niece. Louis Malle wrote the script in conjunction with Jean-Claude Carriere. Music is by Stephane Grappelli.

results.title: Maurice
results.creator_credit: Merchant Ivory Productions, Cinecan, Film Four International, Ismail Merchant and James Ivory
results.brief_description: E. M. Forster ordered that his novel “Maurice” was not to be published until well after his death. Maurice (James Wilby) is a young law student destined for the privileges and security of his class. While at University Maurice begins a passionate love affair with the classics loving Clive (Hugh Grant). In the strict Platonic codes of the University, homosexuality is tolerated but once Clive and Maurice graduate the demands of bourgeois life mean that they must finish their love affair. While Clive recants his earlier love, Maurice finds it increasingly difficult to hide his homosexuality. Meeting the working-class stable boy Scudder (Rupert Graves), he finally rejects the Victorian morality of the bourgeoisie and makes a decision for individual freedom. Lush, elegant and masterfully directed by James Ivory, “Maurice” is an intricate study of not only the emergence of homosexual consciousness but also of the confining strictures of the English class structure.

results.title: Matilda
results.creator_credit: Tri-Star Pictures, Danny DeVito, Michael Shamberg, Stacey Sher and Liccy Dahl
results.brief_description: Matilda Wormwood (Mara Wilson) is a very special girl with an unfortunate family. While her elder brother goes to school, (Matilda doesn’t go to school because her parents think she is 2 years younger than she actually is), her father goes to work as a shonky car salesman (he’s being investigated by the FBI) and her mother plays bingo, Matilda educates herself at the local library. Reading provides her with some assurance that she’s not alone, but she longs to go to school and meet other children. Matilda’s loneliness disappears when she begins school; she makes friends and has a lovely teacher, Miss Honey. The only problem is Miss Honey’s horrible aunt, Trunchbowl, headmistress of the school. Matilda is drawn to the kind Miss Honey and together they set about changing their unhappy lives so that they’re both in a loving family. With Matilda’s magic power that allow her to move objects, anything is possible. Look out nasty parents and evil Trunchbowl! Based on the book by Roald Dahl this is a heartwarming story about how life can change for the better. Starring Mara Wilson, Danny DeVito, Rhea Perlman, Embeth Davidtz and Pam Ferris.

results.title: Master of the house = Du skal aere din hustru: thou shalt honour thy wife
results.creator_credit: Palladium Films and Carl Theodor Dreyer
results.brief_description: Since the collapse of his business, Victor (Meyer) has grown increasingly morose, ill tempered, selfish and demanding. Unaware of the plight of his wife and three children to keep the family fed and clothed, Victor persists in treating his wife harshly, and her health deteriorates. To aid her recovery, Victor’s wife is sent away from the home duties that have burdened her for so long. In exchange, Victor’s old nanny moves in, and treating him as if he was the age when she initially cared for him, shows him the path towards self recognition and amends his cruel ways. Cast includes Johannes Meyer, Astrid Holm, Mathilde Nielson and Clara Schonfeld.

results.title: Mary Shelley's Frankenstein [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Tri-Star Pictures, American Zoetrope, Japan. National Tourist Organisation, Indieprod, Francis Ford Coppola, James V. Hart, John Veitch, David Parfitt and Kenneth Branagh
results.brief_description: At the dawn of the 19th Century, inspired by genius and driven by madness, Victor Frankenstein’s quest for immortality creates an unspeakable terror. Frankenstein is one of the most famous and chilling epic tales. The power and spirit of Mary Shelley’s profound Gothic legend is brought to life in this terrifying, passionate and haunting cinematic masterpiece. An electrifying, full-blooded love story starring Robert De Niro (Creature), Kenneth Branagh (Victor Frankenstein), Tom Hulce (Henry), Helena Bonham Carter (Elizabeth) and Aidan Quinn (Walton). Cast also includes John Cleese (Professor Waldman), Ian Holm (Victor’s father) and Richard Briers (Grandfather).

results.title: Mary Poppins [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Walt Disney Productions, Walt Disney and Robert Stevenson
results.brief_description: Based on the “Mary Poppins” books by P.L. Travers, this Walt Disney masterpiece stars Julie Andrews, Dick Van Dyke, David Tomlinson and Glynis Johns. Disney successfully melds live action sequences with stop-animation, cell animation, song and dance routines. Set in 1910, the story is that of a stultified British family being run with cold efficiency by a draconian father, who pays no mind to his two children, Jane and Michael, and their suffragette mother. The children attempt to gain their parents’ attention by unsettling a slew of nannies, until Mary Poppins arrives to save them. Poppins has magical powers that enchant the children and she eventually brings the family back together, with the aid of her friend Bert (van Dyke). Charming songs include “Chim-Chim-Cher-Ee” and “Supercalifragilisticexpialidocious.” The film was nominated for thirteen Academy Awards, winning five including Best Picture. Screen debut of Julie Andrews, who won the Oscar for Best Actress.

results.title: Marvin's room
results.creator_credit: Miramax Films, Scott Rudin, Tribeca Productions, Jane Rosenthal, Robert De Niro and Jerry Zaks
results.brief_description: Bessie is a strong, sensitive and selfless middle-aged woman who has sacrificed her life to look after her ailing and bed-ridden father and slightly daft aunt. Her younger sister, Lee, shirked off such responsibilities, left home, married and had two children before divorcing. The marked differences between the two have meant that neither sister has been in contact for 20 years. But now Bessie has been diagnosed with leukemia, and her survival may depend on the sister she has long since erased from her life, or her two nephews whom she has never met. Cast includes: Diane Keaton, Meryl Streep, Robert De Niro, and Leonardo Di Caprio.

results.title: Mars attacks! [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Warner Bros Pictures, Tim Burton and Larry Franco
results.brief_description: Science fiction and cult movie fans will warm to Tim Burton’s distinct brand of humour in this sci-fi spoof where, once again, Earth is invaded by martians. These mean green invaders from the Red Planet have slimey humungous brains, are armed with Instr-ray guns, and are cinematically supported by state-of-the-art special effects. The stars that shine here include Jack Nicholson (in a dual role), Glenn Close, Annette Bening, Pierce Brosnan, Danny DeVito, plus many more notable cameos (including one by Tom Jones).

results.title: Married to the mob
results.creator_credit: Orion Pictures Corporation, Mysterious Arts, Kenneth Utt, Edward Saxon and Jonathan Demme
results.brief_description: This comedy from director Jonathan Demme (Philadelphia, Beloved, Something wild, The Silence of the lambs) is a spoof on the mobster/gangster genre. Angela DeMarco is unhappily married to Frank, a low-level mafia operator, and is tired of the mob-life with all the trappings. When Frank dies in mysterious circumstances, Angela decides to start a new life, as far from the mob as she can manage. Unbeknownst to Angela, an FBI agent is trailing her in order to get the dirt on Tony. Complications ensue when the agent following Angela, falls for her instead. Demme keeps the tone light throughout with caricatures of New York mob types, in particular the women with over the top hair and a gaudy aesthetic. Modine does well playing to the stereotype of the uncool, bumbling FBI agent. Cast includes: Michelle Pfeiffer, Dean Stockwell, Matthew Modine, Nancy Travis, Mercedes Ruehl, Joan Cusack, Oliver Platt, Chris Isaak and Alec Baldwin. Music by David Byrne of Talking Heads.
